The cost of attendance (COA) is an estimate of what it costs the typical student to attend Alaska Pacific University. Your COA doesn’t just cover your college tuition; it takes into account your basic living expenses. Room and board will vary based on lifestyle preference. Some courses have fees, such as lab fees, that are not included in mandatory fees listed. Credits may vary by program and semester and year.

When comparing financial aid packages from other schools, make sure you are comparing the total cost of attending that school, not just the total financial aid awarded. It is important for you to budget and make wise decisions regarding how to utilize the financial aid funds you receive.
Early Honors Program for high school students

The cost of the Early Honors Program is a flat tuition rate for up to 18 credit hours per semester. All credits over 18 in a semester are charged at a rate of $445 per credit hour and may be taken only with the permission of the Academic Dean. The following budget is an estimate for a student living with parent(s).

Majors include: Counseling Psychology (BA), Creative & Professional Writing (BA), Environmental Public Health (BS), Health Sciences (BS), Liberal Studies (BA), Marine & Environmental Sciences (BS), Outdoor Studies (BA), Pre-Nursing (BS), Sustainability Studies (BA).

The cost per credit hour for campus undergraduate program part-time attendance is $848. All campus undergraduate program students enrolled in a total course load exceeding 18 credit hours will be charged an overload fee of $545 per credit hour. The following budget is an estimate for a student enrolled full time living on campus.

Majors include: AK Bridge Program (RN to BSN), Alaska Native Governance (BA), Alaska Rural Management (Certificate), Business Administration (AA), Business Administration & Management (BA), Community Health (AAS or Certificate), Health Occupations (AAS or Certificate).
The cost per credit hour for professional studies is $475 per credit hour. The following budget is an estimate for a student living off campus taking six credits per semester (half-time enrollment).
Tuition (based on a 12 credit load per year)

The cost per credit hour for graduate programs is $650 per credit hour. The following budget is an estimate for a student living off campus taking six credits per semester (full-time enrollment). Credits vary by program and semester and year. Please inquire about your specific program.

The cost per credit hour for the Doctorate of Psychology is $840 per credit hour. The following budget is an estimate for a student living off campus taking six credits per semester for three semesters each year. Credits vary by semester and year.
Tuition (based on a 18 credit load per year)

The cost of tuition and fees for the ANELP Certificate is $10,000. Other costs are an estimate of supplies and off campus living expenses for the fall-spring-summer semester sequence of nine credits to complete the program.
